title: Baraka [Widescreen]
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/International understanding
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Urbanization - Environmental aspects
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Film festivals - Canada - Montreal - Awards
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/International understanding
description: Shot in 24 countries, "Baraka" is an extraordinary visual feast that examines the passionate and destructive love/hate relationship between humans and earth. A spectacular diversity of memorable images have been gathered from around the world from the natural and man-made environments, both past and present. The style is strongly reminiscent of the film "Koyaanisqatsi" in its use of timelapse photography juxtaposed with slower sequences, and the somewhat sentimental, simplistic portrayal of humanity.
